name: Reference - How ASLR protects Linux systems from buffer overflow attacks - Network World
x_kb_abstract: ASLR (Address Space Layout Randomization) is a memory exploitation mitigation technique used on both Linux and Windows systems. Learn how to tell if it's running, enable/disable it, and get a view of how it works.
x_kb_reference_title: How ASLR protects Linux systems from buffer overflow attacks
